snippet: Iran and a group of six world powers completed a deal on Sunday that will temporarily freeze much of Tehran’s nuclear program in exchange for limited relief from Western economic sanctions.
abstract: Iran and group of six world powers complete deal that will temporarily freeze much of country's nuclear program in exchange for limited relief from Western economic sanctions; agreement comes despite opposition of Iranian hard-liners, Israeli leaders and criticism from some American lawmakers.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Paris, and Eric Schmitt from Washington and Manama, Bahrain. Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Iran and a group of six world powers completed a deal on Sunday that will temporarily freeze much of Tehran’s nuclear program in exchange for limited relief from Western economic sanctions.

headline.main: Negotiators Put Final Touches on Iran Accord
headline.print_headline: Negotiators Put Final Touches on Iran Accord
